intro: Cunila hispida, commonly known as hairy cunila, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive, spicy scent, while its small white flowers bloom in clusters. Cunila hispida is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
